---
title: "Finding groups"
---

## Description

You want to find information on Connect groups.

## Recipe: Find groups

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

## Python

```{.python}
groups = client.groups.find()
```

### Example Output

```{.python}
>>> pl.DataFrame(groups)
shape: (1, 11)
┌─────────────────────────────────┬──────────┬────────────────┬────────────┬───┬──────────────────────┬──────────────────────┬───────────┬────────┐
│ guid                            ┆ username ┆ email          ┆ first_name ┆ … ┆ updated_time         ┆ active_time          ┆ confirmed ┆ locked │
│ ---                             ┆ ---      ┆ ---            ┆ ---        ┆   ┆ ---                  ┆ ---                  ┆ ---       ┆ ---    │
│ str                             ┆ str      ┆ str            ┆ str        ┆   ┆ str                  ┆ str                  ┆ bool      ┆ bool   │
╞═════════════════════════════════╪══════════╪════════════════╪════════════╪═══╪══════════════════════╪══════════════════════╪═══════════╪════════╡
```

## Recipe: Find a group

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

## Python

```{.python}
group = client.groups.find_one(prefix='Friends')
```

### Example Output
